title: err riot i just had a flex rank game against 300+ higher mmr team
body:
1583 vs 1891 

and riot thinks its not too much?

replies.body:
MMR calculators from 3rd party  websites are often wildly inaccurate due to the fact that **Riot has not and will not release the algorithm to calculate MMR**. 

Matchmaking in the middle of the night and small hours of the morning is likely to be a little bit messed up due to our small server population getting even smaller when everyone goes to bed. As a result, the system tries to match players up with a slightly bigger range than usual, so you don't have to wait for an hour. 

The other thing is that sites like OP.GG are still displaying soloq rank in flex games, and if you investigate further into the flex ranks of the players, it is likely that they are actually pretty close to one another.
